Mapbox GL Style Reference

The Mapbox GL style is an object that defines what data to draw, the order to draw it in, and how to style the data when drawing it. The JSON structure follows the renderer implementation very closely. It provides the basic building blocks out of which more complex styles can be built.

Key: required supports function values transitionable

Root level keys

version enum Options: 3  

Stylesheet version number. Must be 3.

constants constants

An object of constants to be referenced in layers.

sources sources  

Data source specifications for layers to pull from.

layers array  

A an array of layers. The order of layers coincides with the order they will be drawn.

sprite sprite

Sprite definition.

sprite

string

A base URL for retrieving the sprite image and metadata. The extensions `.png`, `.json` and scale factor `@2x.png` will be automatically appended.

constants

*

A constant that will be replaced verbatim in the referencing place. This can be anything, including objects and arrays. All variable names must be prefixed with an `@` symbol.

sources

* source

source

type enum Options: vector raster geojson video  

The data type of the source.

url string  

A URL, or URL template to retrive the source data.

glyphs string
tileSize number Default: 512
minZoom number
maxZoom number Default: 22
*

Other keys to configure the data source.

layer

id string

Unique layer name.

ref string

References another layer to copy `source`, `source_layer`, `filter`, and `render` properties from. This allows the layers to share processing and be more efficient.

source string

Name of a source description to be used for this layer. Required if this is not a composite layer.

source-layer string

Layer to use from a vector tile source. Required if this is not a composite layer, and if the source supports multiple layers.

render render

Symbolizer type that should be used to visualize this layer. If unspecified or null, this layer is not treated as a symbolizer and only exists to have properties inherited to other layers using ref.

filter filter

Array or object of filters or expressions.

layers array

If 'type' is 'composite', the child layers are composited together onto the previous level layer level.

rasterize rasterize
style class

Default style properties for this layer.

style.* class

Override style properties for this layer. The class name is the part after the first dot.

rasterize

enabled boolean  
buffer number Default: 0.03125  
size number Default: 256  
blur number  

render

render: fill render: line render: icon render: text render: composite render: raster render: background

render: background

type enum Options: background

render: fill

type enum Options: fill
fill-winding enum Options: non-zero even-odd Default: non-zero

render: line

type enum Options: line
line-cap enum Options: butt round square Default: butt

The display of line endings.

line-join enum Options: bevel round miter Default: miter

The display of lines when joining.

line-miter-limit number Default: 2

Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

line-round-limit number Default: 1

Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

render: icon

type enum Options: icon
icon-size number Default: 16
icon-image string

A string with replaced, referencing the data property to pull from.

icon-spacing number
icon-padding number Default: 2

Padding value around icon bounding box to avoid icon collisions (px).

icon-translate array Default: 0,0    
icon-translate-anchor enum Options: map viewport Default: map
icon-allow-overlap boolean

If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other icons and labels.

icon-ignore-placement boolean

If true, the icon won't affect placement of other icons and labels.

render: text

type enum Options: text
text-field string

Value to use for a text label. Feature properties are specified using tokens like .

text-path enum Options: horizontal curve Default: horizontal
text-font string

Font stack to use for displaying text.

text-max-size number Default: 16

The maximum size text will be displayed.

text-max-width number Default: 15

The maximum line width for text wrapping (em).

text-line-height number Default: 1.2

Text leading value for multi-line text.

text-letter-spacing number

Text kerning value (em).

text-alignment enum Options: center left right Default: center

Text alignment options.

text-vertical-alignment enum Options: top center bottom Default: center

Vertical text alignment options.

text-max-angle number

text-min-distance number Default: 250

Minimum distance between two text labels (px).

text-rotate number
text-slant number

@TODO

text-padding number Default: 2

Padding value around text bounding box to avoid label collisions (px).

text-transform enum Options: none uppercase lowercase Default: none
text-translate array Default: 0,0    
text-translate-anchor enum Options: map viewport Default: map
text-allow-overlap boolean

If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other icons and labels.

text-ignore-placement boolean

If true, the text won't affect placement of other icons and labels.

filter

filter: expression

Various filter expressions. Unless overridden by parent, these are interpreted as `AND`.

array

Various filter expressions. Unless overridden by parent, these are interpreted as `OR`.

filter: expression

& filter

AND operator.

| filter

OR operator.

^ filter

XOR operator.

! filter

NOR operator.

$type enum Options: Point LineString Polygon

Geometry type that features must match.

*

filter: comparison

== filter: value

Equality operator.

=== filter: value

Set equality operator.

!= filter: value

Inequality operator.

!== filter: value

Set inequality operator.

> filter: value

Greater than operator.

>= filter: value

Greater or equal than operator.

< filter: value

Less than operator.

<= filter: value

Less than or equal operator.

in array

Set member operator.

!in array

Not in set operator.

class: fill

fill-enabled boolean Default: true    
fill-antialias boolean Default: true  

Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

fill-opacity number Default: 1    
fill-color color Default: 0,0,0,1    
fill-outline-color color  

The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of 'fill-color' if unspecified.

fill-translate array Default: 0,0    
fill-translate-anchor enum Options: map viewport Default: map
fill-image string

class: line

line-enabled boolean Default: true    
line-opacity number Default: 1    
line-color color Default: 0,0,0,1  
line-translate array Default: 0,0    
line-translate-anchor enum Options: map viewport Default: map
line-width number Default: 1    
line-offset number    

Offset from the center line.

line-blur number Default: 1    
line-dasharray array Default: 1,-1    
line-image string

Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines.

class: icon

icon-enabled boolean Default: true    
icon-opacity number Default: 1    
icon-rotate number  
icon-rotate-anchor enum Options: map viewport Default: viewport

Orientation of icon when map is rotated.

class: text

text-enabled boolean Default: true    
text-opacity number Default: 1    
text-size number Default: 16    

Font size in pixels. If unspecified, the text will be as big as allowed by the layer definition.

text-color color Default: 0,0,0,1  
text-halo-color color Default: 0,0,0,0  
text-halo-width number Default: 0.25    

How far away the halo is from the font outline. A value of 0.75 means that it is as wide as the font outline. Lower values make the halo bigger, higher values make it smaller. TODO: Refactor this to be more sane.

text-halo-blur number Default: 1    

Fade out the halo towards the outside. 1 means no fade out. Higher values mean a higher fade out.

class: composite

composite-enabled boolean Default: true    
composite-opacity number Default: 1    

class: raster

raster-enabled boolean Default: true    
raster-opacity number Default: 1  
raster-spin number    
raster-brightness array Default: 0,1    
raster-saturation number    
raster-contrast number    
raster-fade number    

class: background

background-color color Default: 0,0,0,1    
background-image string

transition

duration number
delay number

Values

Below is a list of values and an explanation of any expression that can be applied to properties in Mapbox GL.

Color

Mapbox GL accepts a variety of syntaxes for colors - HTML-style hex values, rgb, rgba, hsl, and hsla. It also supports the predefined HTML colors names, like yellow and blue.

{
  "line-color": "#ff0",
  "line-color": "#ffff00",
  "line-color": "rgb(255, 255, 0)",
  "line-color": "rgba(255, 255, 0, 1)",
  "line-color": "hsl(100, 50%, 50%)",
  "line-color": "hsla(100, 50%, 50%, 1)",
  "line-color": "yellow"
}

Especially of note is the support for hsl, which can be easier to reason about than rgb().

Enum

TODO

String

A string is basically just text. In the case of Mapbox GL, you're going to put it in quotes. Strings can be anything, though pay attention to the case of text-name - it actually will refer to features, which you refer to by putting them in curly braces, as seen in the example below.

{
  "text-name": ""
}

Boolean

Boolean means yes or no, so it accepts the values true or false.

{
  "fill-enabled": true
}

Number

TODO

Array

Arrays are comma-separated lists of one or more number in a specific order. For example, they're used in line dash arrays, in which the numbers specify intervals of line, break, and line again.

{
  "line-dasharray": [2, 4]
}
